verses.verse: Man <WH120>, that is born <WH3205> of a woman <WH802>, Is of few <WH7116> days <WH3117>, and full <WH7649> of trouble <WH7267>.
He cometh forth <WH3318> like a flower <WH6731>, and is cut down <WH5243>: He fleeth <WH1272> also as a shadow <WH6738>, and continueth not <WH5975>.
And dost thou open <WH6491> thine eyes <WH5869> upon such a one <WH2088>, And bringest <WH935> me into judgment with thee <WH4941>?
Who can bring <WH5414> a clean <WH2889> thing out of an unclean <WH2931>? not one <WH259>.
Seeing <WH518> his days <WH3117> are determined <WH2782>, The number <WH4557> of his months <WH2320> is with thee <WH6213>, And thou hast appointed his bounds <WH2706> that he cannot pass <WH5674>;
Look <WH8159> away from him <WH2308>, that he may rest, Till he shall accomplish <WH7521>, as a hireling <WH7916>, his day <WH3117>.
For there is <WH3426> hope <WH8615> of a tree <WH6086>, If it be cut down <WH3772>, that it will sprout again <WH2498>, And that the tender branch <WH3127> thereof will not cease <WH2308>.
Though the root <WH8328> thereof wax old <WH2204> in the earth <WH776>, And the stock <WH1503> thereof die <WH4191> in the ground <WH6083>;
Yet through the scent <WH7381> of water <WH4325> it will bud <WH6524>, And put forth <WH6213> boughs <WH7105> like a plant <WH5194>.
But man <WH1397> dieth <WH4191>, and is laid low <WH2522>: Yea <WH120>, man giveth up the ghost <WH1478>, and where is he?
As the waters <WH4325> fail <WH235> from the sea <WH3220>, And the river <WH5104> wasteth <WH2717> and drieth up <WH3001>;
So man <WH376> lieth down <WH7901> and riseth <WH6965> not <WH8064>: Till the heavens be no more <WH1115>, they shall not awake <WH6974>, Nor be roused out <WH5782> of their sleep <WH8142>.

Oh that <WH5414> thou wouldest hide <WH6845> me in Sheol <WH7585>, That thou wouldest keep me secret <WH5641>, until thy wrath <WH639> be past <WH7725>, That thou wouldest appoint <WH7896> me a set time <WH2706>, and remember me <WH2142>!
If a man <WH1397> die <WH4191>, shall he live <WH2421> again <WH3117>? All the days of my warfare <WH6635> would I wait <WH3176>, Till my release <WH2487> should come <WH935>.
Thou wouldest call <WH7121>, and I would answer <WH6030> thee <WH3700>: Thou wouldest have a desire to the work <WH4639> of thy hands <WH3027>.
But now thou numberest <WH5608> my steps <WH6806>: Dost thou not watch <WH8104> over my sin <WH2403>?
My transgression <WH6588> is sealed up <WH2856> in a bag <WH6872>, And thou fastenest up <WH2950> mine iniquity <WH5771>.
But <WH199> the mountain <WH2022> falling <WH5307> cometh to nought <WH5034>; And the rock <WH6697> is removed <WH6275> out of its place <WH4725>;

The waters <WH4325> wear <WH7833> the stones <WH68>; The overflowings thereof wash away <WH7857> the <WH5599> dust <WH6083> of the earth <WH776>: So thou destroyest <WH6> the hope <WH8615> of man <WH582>.
Thou prevailest <WH8630> for ever <WH5331> against him <WH1980>, and he passeth; Thou changest <WH8138> his countenance <WH6440>, and sendest him away <WH7971>.
His sons <WH1121> come to honor <WH3513>, and he knoweth <WH3045> it not <WH6819>; And they are brought low, but he perceiveth it not of them <WH995>.
But his flesh <WH1320> upon him hath pain <WH3510>, And his soul <WH5315> within him mourneth <WH56>.
